intro: Micromeria viminea, commonly known as the slender micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is a low-growing shrub with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its botanical features include glandular hairs on the stems and leaves, which contribute to its aromatic properties. Micromeria viminea is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
